result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
from defendant regarding his sentence
from Judge Kirk to defendant with explanation

Veronica Isherwood, ADA present. 
Attorney Troy Nielsen present. 
Defendant present. 
15CF176 - information and amended information filed with the Court. 
Attorney Nielsen acknowledges receipt of information and amended information and waives reading. 
Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed with Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest pleas to count 1 in 14CM210; count 1 in 15CF176; counts 2, 3 and 5 in 15CF220 and counts 1, 2 and 3 in 15CF216. 
Per ADA Isherwood - State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of count 1 in 14CM210; count 1 in 14CM326, count 1 in 15CF176; counts 2, 3 and 5 in 15CF220 and counts 2 and 3 in 15CF216 but withholds finding of guilty regarding count 1 in 15CF216 to allow DPA to take effect. 
All other remaining counts in all cases are dismissed and read-in. 
Court amends bond in 15CF216 regarding count 1 to reflect $5,000.00 signature bond only. 
Court orders sentence withheld - probation 2 years. 
Conditions of probation:
- Pay costs
- Supervsion fees
- Pay restitution of $5,463.80 in 15CF176 
Credit if revoked - 24 days - 15CF176, 4 days 15CF216 and 1 day 14CM210. 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.

ADA Veronica Isherwood, Present
  Defendant: Present
  Attorney  Troy Nielsen:  Present
  Bond continued.

ADA Veronica Isherwood, Present
  Defendant present, in custody
  Attorney  Troy Nielsen, Present
Signature Bond $1,000
***covers 15CM194/15CM176***

Defendant Jordan D. Fritch in court (in custody) with attorney Troy L. Nielsen.

Complaint received, reading waived. 
Not guilty plea entered. 
ADA Isherwood requests cash bond on 15CM194 & 15CF176.
